sect1.para: The minimal configuration for a NetBSD/prep system requires 16M of RAM and about 100M of disk space. For a full installation (including source and X11), at least 32M of RAM and 200M of disk space are recommended.

Supported system models include:
IBM 6015 (40P) IBM 6040 (ThinkPad 820) IBM 6050 (Power Series 830) IBM 7248 (43P/100, 43P/120, 43P/133) IBM 7043 (43P-140) IBM 7024 (E20 and E30) IBM 7025 (F30 and F40) Motorola Powerstack E1 Motorola Ultra 603 and Ultra Plus (Bull ESTRELLA 200) Motorola MTX604 series machines

Devices for which support does not exist are:
Floppy disk controller Secondary PCI bridge on F40. SMP

Except for those specifically listed above, devices (driver names in parenthesis) supported by NetBSD/prep include:
Machine-independent drivers for ISA devices Machine-independent drivers for EISA devices Machine-independent drivers for PCI devices Machine-independent drivers for PCMCIA devices Machine-independent drivers for SCSI devices. Machine-independent drivers for USB devices Machine-independent drivers for MII devices (IEEE 802.3 Media Independent Interface, typically used for physical media interfaces for FastEthernet controllers) The PC speaker (pcppi) PS/2 mouse (pms) Joysticks on game ports (joy) VGA and SVGA Display Adapters (wscons). Note: presently only text mode is supported.
